sentences.en: ...a man of great sagacity and immense experience.
sentences.cn: ...一个极为睿智且经验丰富的男人。

sentences.en: A spot of sagacity is also advisable.
sentences.cn: 一些明智的判断是可取的.

sentences.en: All his sagacity seemed to desert him.
sentences.cn: 他似乎完全失去洞察力.

sentences.en: Fox - One who will use all thatmay posses of sagacity, wit or wisdom in his own defense.
sentences.cn: 狐狸 - 能够运用自己全部的精明 、 机敏和智慧来自卫的人.

sentences.en: He had a reputation for business sagacity.
I admire your foresight and sagacity.
I hesitate to record the many other instances of his sagacity.
sentences.cn: 我不大愿意把关于他如何聪明的其他许多事例写下来.

sentences.en: In his speech Mr. Brown laid stress on the sagacity of cats.
sentences.cn: 布朗先生在他的讲座里强调了猫的灵性.

sentences.en: It required a statesman's foresight and sagacity to make the decision.
sentences.cn: 作出这个决定需要政治家的远见卓识.

sentences.en: My grandfather was venerable for his age, his uprightness, and sagacity.
sentences.cn: 我祖父以他的年长, 正直和睿智而受人尊敬.

sentences.en: Oh, indeed! Well , then, I must trust to my own sagacity.
sentences.cn: 噢, 确实! 那么, 我就只能靠自己的智慧了.

sentences.en: Sagacity, unlike cleverness, may increase with age.
sentences.cn: 睿智与机灵不同, 前者可随着年龄增加.

sentences.en: Sagacity, unlike cleverness, usually increases with age.
sentences.cn: 明智和聪明不同, 通常是随着年龄增长的.
那个法官有敏锐的洞察力.

sentences.en: The politician showed a good sagacity avoiding the mistakes he'd made in the previous campaign.
sentences.cn: 那个政客表现出相当的睿智,从而避免在之前的选战中犯过的错误.

sentences.en: These inventions had obtained for him the renown of more than human sagacity.
sentences.cn: 他的这些发明使人们把他看得神乎其神.
